Electrical Engineer Job at Paras Energy




        
    

        
        
     

            
    

Paras Energy was incorporated in the year 2002. We are a diversified and internationally recognized energy company that provides stable and reliable power to all customers by generation and distribution of power while maintaining stringent adherence to OEM guidelines of operation and maintenance. Apart from power generation and distribution, we can also provide EPC and maintenance services for substations, transmission line and pressure reducing & measuring stations. At Paras Energy, we believe that electricity should be accessible and affordable to all. Over the years, we have gathered a diverse clientele all over Nigeria and we continue to grow our portfolio through the provision of reliable services. On 8th April 2016, Paras Energy became the 27th Company to supply power to National Grid in Nigeria and the first privately owned company to supply power under a bilateral agreement to their customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer
Job Location: Kano
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	HND or B.Eng. in Electrical Engineering with experience on Solar Systems.
	2-5 years of working experience with any solar energy company.
	Ideal Candidates will be resident, in Kano State, or willing to relocate to Kano State at their own expense.
	Be Innovative, creative, hardworking, resilient, and self-motivated
	Ability to work on shifts including Saturdays.
	This position requires frequent traveling within and out of the country
	Must be safety oriented.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@Parasenergy.com and copy hr.abuja@Parasenergy.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the    

    

        Click here to Apply

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Officer (School)

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Key Responsibilities and Duties


	Front Office & Communication: Serving as the first point of contact for parents and visitors, answering phones, managing emails, and handling inquiries.
	Record Management: Maintaining accurate student records, attendance data, and staff information using school management software.
	Financial Administration: Assisting with budgeting, processing invoices, managing petty cash, and ordering school supplies.
	Operational Support: Coordinating school events, meetings, and assemblies, as well as providing administrative support to teachers.
	Compliance & Safety: Ensuring school policies, regulations, and safety procedures are followed.
	Facility Management: Overseeing the maintenance of school buildings and grounds, sometimes assisting with contractor hiring for repairs.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's or Master's Degree with 2-5 years of experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Info@kydalofficepoint using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
